sentence.Network_en: She repeated her protestation of innocence.
sentence.Network_cn: 她再度强调自己是清白的。

sentence.Network_en: Despite their protestation, they were glad to accept our help.
sentence.Network_cn: 尽管他们严肃地表明了态度, 但他们仍乐于接受我们的援助.

sentence.Network_en: They have to make a protestation of that news.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们不得不为了那条消息作出声明.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, from late Latin protestatio(n-), from protestari 'to protest' (see protest)

entry.def: A protestation is a strong declaration  that something is true or not true.

example.ex: Despite his constant protestations of devotion and love, her doubts persisted.
example.tran: 尽管他一直宣称对她的爱忠贞不渝，她仍然心存怀疑。

means.word_mean: 1. a formal and solemn declaration of objection;

sentences.sentence: "they finished the game under protest to the league president"
"the senator rose to register his protest"
"the many protestations did not stay the execution"

auth_sentence.content: It is a form of protestation which is normal in diplomatic practice, he added.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is a form of protestation which is normal in diplomatic practice, he added.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is a form of protestation which is normal in diplomatic practice, he added.

auth_sentence.content: No, he doesn't go as deep into his own psyche as that alleyway protestation might suggest.
auth_sentence.res_content: No, he doesn't go as deep into his own psyche as that alleyway protestation might suggest.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: No, he doesn't go as deep into his own psyche as that alleyway protestation might suggest.

auth_sentence.content: Waiting To Be Heard, a protestation of her innocence, is due out next month.
